Reposting latest comment here for visibility.

Hi, any hints on how to disable CSRF token from docker-compose or the zulip config file for the latest version? Because the solution from https://github.com/zulip/zulip/issues/10527#issuecomment-517962839 doesn't work for me with the latest version. Thanks!
Disabling CSRF protection is not something you should do, ever.

I think this should be framed as "getting CSRF protection to work when TLS termination is done outside of the host, in Docker." I don't understand at quick skim why the Docker bit interferes with using http_only to make this work.
The issue is years old and the latest comment was posted by someone completely new, so itâ€™s hard to tell whether their underlying problem is the same.
